title: projection
description: The set of parameters for the projection that applies to the resource.

identifier.description: The identifier for the projection. Combine with a namespace to explicitly identify the projection. For example, code="albers" and namespace="org.adiwg.code.mapProjection".

description.description: A description of a projection, not defined elsewhere in the standard, that was used for the data set. The information provided shall include the name of the projection, names of parameters and values used for the data set, and the citation of the specification for the algorithms that describe the mathematical relationship between Earth and plane or developable surface for the projection.

A complete description of a grid system, not defined elsewhere in this standard, that was used for the data set. The information provided shall include the name of the grid system, the names of the parameters and values used for the data set, and the citation of the specification for the algorithms that describe the mathematical relationship between the Earth and the coordinates of the grid system.

name.description: A descriptive name for the projection.

gridIdentifier.description: The identifier for the grid system.

identifier.description: The identifier for the grid system. Combine with a namespace to explicitly identify the grid system. For example, code="utm" and namespace="org.adiwg.code.mapGridSystem".

description.description: A complete description of a grid system, not defined elsewhere in this standard, that was used for the data set. The information provided shall include the name of the grid system, the names of the parameters and values used for the data set, and the citation of the specification for the algorithms that describe the mathematical relationship between the Earth and the coordinates of the grid system.

name.description: A descriptive name for the grid system.

gridZone.description: The unique zone identifier for grid coordinate systems.

standardParallel1.description: The line of constant latitude at which the surface of the Earth and the plane or developable surface intersect.

standardParallel2.description: The line of constant latitude at which the surface of the Earth and the plane or developable surface intersect.

longitudeOfCentralMeridian.description: The line of longitude at the center of a map projection generally used as the basis for constructing the projection.

latitudeOfProjectionOrigin.description: The latitude chosen as the origin of rectangular coordinates for a map projection.

falseEasting.description: The value added to all 'x' values in the rectangular coordinates for a map projection. This value frequently is assigned to eliminate negative numbers.

falseNorthing.description: The value added to all 'y' values in the rectangular coordinates for a map projection. This value frequently is assigned to eliminate negative numbers.

falseEastingNorthingUnits.description: The units of measure for falseEasting and falseNorthing.

scaleFactorAtEquator.description: A multiplier for reducing a distance obtained from a map by computation or scaling to the actual distance along the equator.

heightOfProspectivePointAboveSurface.description: The height of viewpoint above the Earth, expressed in meters.

longitudeOfProjectionCenter.description: The longitude of the point of projection for azimuthal projections.

latitudeOfProjectionCenter.description: The latitude of the point of projection for azimuthal projections.

scaleFactorAtCenterLine.description: A multiplier for reducing a distance obtained from a map by computation or scaling to the actual distance along the center line.

scaleFactorAtCentralMeridian.description: A multiplier for reducing a distance obtained from a map by computation or scaling to the actual distance along the central meridian.

straightVerticalLongitudeFromPole.description: The longitude to be oriented straight up from the North or South Pole.

scaleFactorAtProjectionOrigin.description: A multiplier for reducing a distance obtained from a map by computation or scaling to the actual distance at the projection origin.

azimuthAngle.description: The angle measured clockwise from north, and expressed in degrees.

FGDC CSDGM: spref > horizsys > planar > mapprojp > obqlazim > azimangl

azimuthMeasurePointLongitude.description: The longitude of the map projection origin.

FGDC CSDGM: spref > horizsys > planar > mapprojp > obqlazim > azimptl

landsatNumber.description: The number of the Landsat satellite.

landsatPath.description: The number of the orbit of the Landsat satellite.

obliqueLinePoint.description: The method used to describe the line along which an oblique Mercator map projection is centered using two points near the limits of the mapped region that define the center line.

FGDC CSDGM: spref > horizsys > planar > mapproj > obqmerc > obqlpt

items.title: point
items.description: A point near the limits of the mapped region that define the center line for an oblique Mercator map projection.

obliqueLineLatitude.description: The latitude of a point defining the oblique line.

FGDC CSDGM: spref > horizsys > planar > mapproj > obqmerc > obqlpt > obqllat

obliqueLineLongitude.description: The longitude of a point defining the oblique line.

local.description: A description of a local coordinate system.

description.description: A description of the local reference system.

georeference.description: A description of the information provided to register the local system to the Earth (e.g. control points, satellite ephemeral data, inertial navigation data).

fixedToEarth.description: True if the z-axis of the coordinate system coincides with a plumb line through the origin that locally is aligned with the surface of the Earth.
